bug.author: ryanwadebg
bug.summary: The link to the GitHub site is broken
bug.description:
[Enter feedback here] The link to the GitHub site is broken. I tried to find similar documentation in the repo but could not find any. Please advise where I should go. <denchmark-h:hr></denchmark-h>
<denchmark-h:h4>Document Details</denchmark-h>
⚠ Do not edit this section. It is required for docs.microsoft.com ➟ GitHub issue linking.
ID: fd3321a1-39ab-8e41-f678-68ddbb939a17 Version Independent ID: b49c840c-1dca-7113-4160-bc767cc4f31e Content: azureml-dataprep package - Azure Machine Learning Python Content Source: AzureML-Docset/stable/docs-ref-autogen/azureml-dataprep/index.yml Service: machine-learning Sub-service: core GitHub Login: @DebFro Microsoft Alias: debfro

comments.comment: Hi, what is the issue you encountered when you open <denchmark-link:https://github.com/microsoft/AMLDataPrepDocs>https://github.com/microsoft/AMLDataPrepDocs</denchmark-link> ? I can open the link and view the files.

Hello. That is interesting because I get a 404 error.
Sent from my T-Mobile 4G LTE Device Get Outlook for Android<<denchmark-link:https://aka.ms/ghei36>https://aka.ms/ghei36</denchmark-link> > <denchmark-link:#>…</denchmark-link>
________________________________ From: Xun Wang <notifications@github.com> Sent: Friday, August 7, 2020 1:42:05 AM To: Azure/MachineLearningNotebooks <MachineLearningNotebooks@noreply.github.com> Cc: Ryan Wade <rwade@blue-granite.com>; Author <author@noreply.github.com> Subject: Re: [Azure/MachineLearningNotebooks] The link to the GitHub site is broken (#1090)
Hi, what is the issue you encountered when you open https://github.com/microsoft/AMLDataPrepDocs? I can open the link and view the files.
— You are receiving this because you authored the thread. Reply to this email directly, view it on GitHub<#1090 (comment)>, or unsubscribe<https://github.com/notifications/unsubscribe-auth/ANOUPYR5P23Q46BRXRRBPDTR7OH23ANCNFSM4PXAISPQ>.
This is what I see when I click on the link: <denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/56444898/89648550-5f5adc80-d88d-11ea-92c2-5f137500c539.png></denchmark-link>
It seems the link is set as "internal". Let me confirm with the team and get back to you.
Thanks SturgeonMi, I look forward to what you find. Ryan

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/MayMSFT>@MayMSFT</denchmark-link> As we synced offline, you indicated the Dataprep SDK is deprecated, we are having new SDK experience. <denchmark-link:https://github.com/ryanwadebg>@ryanwadebg</denchmark-link> Do you have specific questions towards some specific tasks? Or you want to check what's the current Github folder for instructions towards tasks/contents contained in <denchmark-link:https://github.com/microsoft/AMLDataPrepDocs>https://github.com/microsoft/AMLDataPrepDocs</denchmark-link> ? (Tasks e.g. How to load data is an overview guide on how to load data using the Data Prep SDK. How to transform data is an overview guide on how to transform data. How to write data is an overview guide on how to write data to different storage locations. )

The dataprep package is deprecated for internal use only. Customers are encouraged to use <denchmark-link:https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/machine-learning/how-to-create-register-datasets>auzreml dataset</denchmark-link> to access and load data from cloud. We are working on removing the API reference for dataprep to avoid user confusion in the future. sorry for this.
Thanks for the update <denchmark-link:https://github.com/MayMSFT>@MayMSFT</denchmark-link> . Trying to keep up with these changes and the direction you all are going is quite confusing.
Is there a road map for AML? I know there is one for Power BI. Is there is something similar for AML that you can share with the public?
